introduction.p: Each test case step that can result in a reportable bug has a pattern for reporting that bug. More than one bug pattern may be associated with a step. For most bugs, you will find and use one of the anticipated bug patterns when reporting.

prerequisites.p: Before you begin, make sure you have:

ul.li: A second copy of this manual open to the test case step that failed.
A text editor open, ready for entering a bug report.

steps.p: Here are the steps to follow when reporting a software bug to the Language Software Test Department:
steps.step: On the test case step which failed, click the link to its bug patterns.
If you have access to the bug tracking system, find a similar bug using the information in the bug pattern action or category. You may be able to add your new information to that bug.

Cut-and-paste the appropriate bug pattern from the manual to the top of the document in your editor.
Bugs will appear in reverse order, but you won't lose your place as easily.
For many bugs, the fields in the pattern are already filled in. For lower-level or more general bugs, you may have to supply this data.
When you have finished testing, save your document for submission.
